segments.lesson_summary: Summary of segment 4: The Ministry of Education, the Department for Planning and Developing Curriculum in all sectors, has designed a math curriculum for 7th-grade students. In this curriculum, students will learn about comparing numbers, including identifying which number is to the right or left of another. They will also explore the various uses of negative numbers, such as profit and loss, altitudes above sea level, and temperature. Additionally, students will practice arithmetic operations involving negative numbers, focusing on multiplication. This curriculum aims to deepen students' understanding of mathematical concepts and build their problem-solving skills in relation to negative numbers.
